intro: Batrachium lenormandii, commonly known as the Lenormand's batrachium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
